means: 著作家( author的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Authors are famously ignorant about the realities of publishing.
sentence.Network_cn: 作者们不了解出版界的实际情况，这是人所共知的。

sentence.Network_en: It soon became clear that authors were decidedly in the majority.
sentence.Network_cn: 作家占绝大多数，这一点很快就变得明了起来。

sentence.Network_en: The authors demanded excision of foreign words.
sentence.Network_cn: 作者们要求删除外国文字。

PerfectNetExp.abs: the vast majority of today's instant authors may sell a dozen copies of books , but on-demand publishing is letting thousands realize the ambitions of generations of would-be writers .现在的大多数业余作家的作品也许就能卖出去几十本，但按需出版却让成千人实现了“作家”梦。

那么授权（Authorization）又是什么呢？授权通常是用来回答以下问题：用户A是否被授权访问资源R 用户A是否被授权执行P操作

entry.def: The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.

example.ex: ...Jill Phillips, author of the book 'Give Your Child Music'.
example.tran: 吉尔·菲利普斯，《给孩子音乐》一书的作者

entry.def: An author is a person whose job is writing books.

example.ex: Haruki Murakami is Japan's best-selling author.
example.tran: 村上春树是日本当红的畅销书作家。

entry.tran: (计划或建议的）筹划者，制定者
entry.def: The author of a plan or proposal is the person who thinks of it and works out the details.

example.ex: The authors of the plan believe they can reach this point within about two years.
example.tran: 该计划的提出者相信他们约在两年内可以达成该目标。

entry.def: To author something means to be the author of it.

example.ex: Then he opened a restaurant, authored a book, and landed his own radio show.
example.tran: 后来他开了个餐馆，写了本书，还制作了自己的广播剧。

example.ex: ...a proposal authored by subcommittee chairman Quentin Burdick.
example.tran: 专门小组委员会主席昆廷·伯迪克提出的建议

Sentence.sentence: Authors still published in printed versions will be considered important ones.

The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.
Several opponents have recently emerged, ranging from rival tech giants such as Microsoft and Amazon to small bodies representing authors and publishers across the world.
Broadly, the deal provides a mechanism for Google to compensate authors and publishers whose rights it has breached (including giving them a share of any future revenue it generates from their works)
the copyright of authors of out-of-print books
